{{cpp/string/basic_string/title|npos}}
{{cpp/string/basic_string/navbar}}
{{ddcl|1=
static const size_type npos = -1;
}}

This is a special value equal to the maximum value representable by the type {{rlpt|/#Member types|size_type}}. The exact meaning depends on context, but it is generally used either as end of string indicator by the functions that expect a string index or as the error indicator by the functions that return a string index.

===Note===
Although the definition uses {{c|-1}}, {{tt|size_type}} is an unsigned integer type, and the value of {{tt|npos}} is the largest positive value it can hold, due to [[cpp/language/implicit conversion#Integral conversions|signed-to-unsigned implicit conversion]]. This is a portable way to specify the largest value of any unsigned type.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;bitset&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    // string search functions return npos if nothing is found
    std::string s = "test";
    if (s.find('a') == s.npos)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "no 'a' in 'test'\n";

    // functions that take string subsets as arguments 
    // use npos as the "all the way to the end" indicator
    std::string s2(s, 2, std::string::npos);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; s2 &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::bitset&lt;5&gt; b("aaabb", std::string::npos, 'a', 'b');
    std::cout &lt;&lt; b &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
no 'a' in 'test'
st
00011
}}
